issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

fields.summary: Error during update: No repository found

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: Studio
components.description: Please enter tickets related to Titanium Studio here.

comments.body: Trying ti info, ti config, etc I get FATAL ERROR: Error: Unable to parse config file

Your config.json file may be corrupt. Verify whether or not is valid by using a formatter i.e. http://www.jsonlint.com

You can browse it by typing at the system terminal:

open ~/.titanium/config.json

Yup, it does seem a bit corrupt. Don't know how that happened since I've never touched that file... and Studio works fine....
Where can I get a sample config.json that I can use as a template? Or is there a way to fix it from Studio?
OK - fixed the config.json file, and the update still fails as before. ti info looks fine.

Doing a manual update as specified here: http://download.appcelerator.com/appcelerator/studio/standalone/update/stable/
worked for me.
If you are experiencing an issue with a corrupt JSON, please follow along on TIMOB-17346.

For this issue, I believe this is likely a traffic overload problem (https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=290782). If it can't contact the servers (either you are offline or on a flaky connection, or our severs are overloaded), it can run into this issue. Is anyone still seeing it today?
Yup, happened numerous times today too. Succeeded only with the manual update.
You can also try the workarounds posted on http://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/tis/Errors+While+Updating, mainly the part on reloading the appropriate update site?.

Hello [~mokesmokes]!

Did the last workaround work for you?

Best Regards!
Mauro, I updated manually - see my earlier comment

Hello [~mokesmokes]!

Please describe what do you mean with manual update. In the form of:

1. Open Titanium Studio
2. Go to Help Menu
3. Select Titanium Updates

or something pretty specific so we can try to reproduce it. 

Please disable any software sources that you might added to your Titanium Studio (i.e., When I need to install MAT into my Ti Studio, I need to add a couple of extra software sources, that break the update capability of Ti Studio itself). 

Best Regards!

I just followed the manual update instructions here:
http://download.appcelerator.com/appcelerator/studio/standalone/update/stable/

Hello [~mokesmokes]: 

Do you have enough administrative permissions for doing the update? 

Best Regards
Resolving since we can't reproduce this.
